title: Hollyoaks spoilers: Disaster strikes as village is torn apart in devastating stunt week
text:
(Picture: Lime Pictures)

Hollyoaks have something of a reputation when it comes to impeccable stunts, and this year is shaping up to be no different as the soap goes all out with a devastating event that could very well change the face of the village as we know it, as Cindy Cunningham’s (Stephanie Waring) plans to move forward with her ‘Grande Bizarre’ — against safety regulations — results in absolute chaos ensuing.

Diggers and crane arrive in the village — much to everyone’s dismay — and Cindy’s delighted, as dreams of her empire are set to become a reality. However, the tunnels below are incredibly fragile, and they feel the strain of the arriving machinery almost immediately. Meanwhile a concerned Tom (Ellis Hollins) voices his concerns about the lack of health and safety regulations and thus stages a protest.

It doesn’t take long for Cindy to get agitated by how slow the work is progressing, and thus she voices her frustrations, however a tonne bag of sand slips from a nearby crane and nearly lands on both her and Tom — but thankfully it misses both of them.

(Picture: Lime Pictures)

This is just the beginning, as almost every villager finds themselves caught up in the drama — including Breda (Moya Brady), who already has enough on her mind — what with her having promised Tony (Nick Pickard) that he can return home. The villainous granny suffers an accident and crashes into one of the nearby cranes — an incident which causes a crack in the village floor.

(Picture: Lime Pictures)

Meanwhile, Charlie and Ella — both of whom are in the tunnels — find themselves trapped as the ceiling starts to collapse, and they can’t remember which way they came in!

Woody (Jake Quickenden) informs everyone that it’s simply too dangerous to move the crane, but Luke — who’s been drinking —is having none of his excuses, and — determined to build his restaurant — jumps on board to finish the job.

(Picture: Lime Pictures)

Concerned, Nancy (Jessica Fox) asks Darren (Ashley Taylor Dawson) for help in putting a stop to Luke. However, it’s no use, as Luke turns the crane on and proceeds to lose control — much to everyone’s dismay — and he begs Woody to help him. The steel girders — which are loaded in the crane’s arm — swing atop the village. As a result, Luke exits the cabin.

Later, a steel girder falls from the crane — but will anyone be injured as a result?

Mitchell (Imran Adams) and Scott (Ross Adams) are also caught up in the drama, as are Sienna (Anna Passey) and Finn (Keith Rice) — both of whom are in their flats and see the crane swinging out of control from their window.

It’s certainly set to be an eventful week for Hollyoaks, but the question is: will anyone lose their life as a result?

One to watch: Tuesday 29th October at 7pm on E4.

description: Chaos ensues during Hollyoaks' biggest week of the year.
